intro: Heracleum transiliense, commonly known as the Siberian cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features tall, hollow stems and large, compound leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in umbrella-like inflorescences, typical of the carrot family. Heracleum transiliense is known for its potential medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
